meanings.definition: To agree or be in harmony
meanings.sent1: The team jibed on the plan for the project.
meanings.sent2: The siblings jibed on which movie to watch.
meanings.sent3: Their laughter jibed perfectly, creating a joyful atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: Her cheerful personality jibed with the positive vibes of the party.
meanings.sent5: The colors of the painting jibed beautifully, creating a stunning masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To make a mocking or sarcastic remark
meanings.sent1: He often jibed at his friend's fashion choices.
meanings.sent2: The comedian jibed about current events in his stand-up routine.
meanings.sent3: His playful jibe jibed well with the light-hearted mood of the gathering.
meanings.sent4: The sharp jibe jibed with the sarcastic tone of the conversation.
meanings.sent5: Her witty jibe jibed perfectly, eliciting laughter from the audience.

meanings.definition: To shift a sail or boom in sailing
meanings.sent1: The sailor jibed the sail to catch the wind from the other direction.
meanings.sent2: During the race, they had to jibe quickly to maintain speed.
meanings.sent3: The sudden jibe caused the boat to tilt slightly, surprising the passengers.
meanings.sent4: The precise jibe helped the boat navigate through the rough waters smoothly.
meanings.sent5: With a swift jibe, the sailor adjusted the sail for optimal performance.
